metadata.title: CVE-2017-3313 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: MyISAM). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.53 andearlier, 5.6.34 and earlier and 5.7.16 and earlier. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows low privileged attacker with logon to theinfrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized accessto critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data.CVSS v3.0 Base Score 4.7 (Confidentiality impacts).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libmariadbclient18 - 10.1.24-5
libmariadbd18 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-client - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-client-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-client-core-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-common - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-connect - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-spider - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-server - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-server-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-server-core-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-test - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-test-data - 10.1.24-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.17-0ubuntu1').
mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.1.24-5').
